sentences.english: And the dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel， and there shall be none to bury her.
sentences.chinese: 耶洗别必在耶斯列田里被狗所吃，无人葬埋。

sentences.english: But when they went out to bury her, they found nothing except her skull, her feet and her hands.
sentences.chinese: 他们就去葬埋她，只寻得她的头骨和脚，并手掌。

sentences.english: And they told David, saying, That the men of Jabeshgilead were they that buried Saul.
sentences.chinese: 有人告诉大卫说，葬埋扫罗的是基列雅比人。

sentences.english: They have poured out blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there is no one to bury the dead.
sentences.chinese: 在耶路撒冷周围流他们的血如水，无人葬埋。

sentences.english: And seven months shall the house of Israel be burying of them, that they may cleanse the land.
sentences.chinese: 以色列家的人必用七个月葬埋他们，为要洁净全地。

sentences.english: All Israel will mourn for him and bury him.
sentences.chinese: 以色列众人必为他哀哭，将他葬埋。

sentences.english: Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem; and there was none to bury them.
sentences.chinese: 在耶路撒冷周围流他们的血如水，无人葬埋。

definition: grave/tomb/graveyard/cemetery/fig. one's native place (where one's ancestors are buried)
to prepare a dead body for coffin
to put dead body in coffin
to bury sth along with the dead/sacrificial grave goods
